stories.title: Faster Zombies to Steam Deck: The History of Valve and Linux Gaming

stories.text:
We have in Mixpanel activity & contact data for thousands of users in hundreds of companies but we needed to know their roles/job titles to find out who were the team leads - so we built our own integration with a 3rd-party provider to get Linkedin contact info -> https://bit.ly/3JsmpRk

Looking into enriching this with more data from LinkedIn, Twitter, AngelList, etc.
stories.title: Show HN: Job Titles in Mixpanel

stories.text:
Sometimes when starting new content websites, I think I could just use a GitHub page instead of a domain.

I mean, myproject.github.io is not worse than something like getmyproject.com, right?

But then I think: I never stumble across Github pages when I google for something. Maybe they are at a disadvantage compared to custom domains?

I know that one can use custom domains for Github pages. But I would like to discuss the effect of using just a github.io page.
stories.title: Ask HN: Are there any popular websites built on github.io?
AIMe registry for artificial intelligence in biomedical research
